message.content:
cs.CR, cs.GT, cs.CY, cs.NI, cs.SE 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - The paper discusses the problem of residual risk elimination in internet security and proposes mechanisms to resolve information asymmetry in cyber-insurance. This falls under the domain of cryptography and security. 
2. cs.GT (Game Theory) - The paper uses the Principal-Agent model from microeconomic theory to design optimal cyber-insurance contracts. This involves game-theoretic analysis and mechanism design, which falls under the domain of game theory. 
3. cs.CY (Computers and Society) - The paper discusses the impact of cyber-insurance on network security and the incentives for self-defense efforts by internet users. This falls under the domain of computers and society. 
4. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the problem of epidemic risks in distributed networks and proposes a framework for cyber-insurance. This falls under the domain of networking and internet architecture. 
5. cs.SE (Software Engineering) - The paper discusses the use of anti-virus and anti-spam software as traditional security mechanisms and proposes cyber-insurance as a complementary mechanism. This falls under the domain of software engineering.
